para.text: If an applicant or licensee receives from the Commission a written communication requesting a response, the applicant or licensee shall respond in writing within 30 days of the date of the mailing.
The Commission shall send a written communication by first-class mail to the last address furnished to the Commission by the applicant or registrant.
It is the applicant’s or registrant’s responsibility to notify the Commission if there has been a change in the applicant’s or registrant’s address.
Failure to respond as required by this regulation may be considered by the Commission to be a violation of Business Occupations and Professions Article, §16-701.2(a)(5), Annotated Code of Maryland.

annotations.annotation: Business Occupations and Professions Article, §§16-216(2) and 16-701.2(a)(5), Annotated Code of Maryland
